J1.help: The tip of the upper jaw.

J2.help: The intersection of the upper and lower jaw. (This is not simply where the skin meets!)

J3.help: The tip of the lower jaw.

E1.help: The most anterior (forward) margin of the eye at its widest diameter.

E2.help: The most posterior (rearward) margin of the eye at its widest diameter.

O1.help: The top point of the preopercule. This may not be visible in certain fishes, if it is not, place the point at the top-left corner of the image and make a comment below.

O2.help: The posterior (rearward) "elbow" of the preopercule. This may not be visible in certain fishes, if it is not, place the point at the top-left corner of the image and make a comment below.

O3.help: The bottom point of the preopercule. This may not be visible in certain fishes, if it is not, place the point at the top-left corner of the image and make a comment below.

O4.help: The top point of the operculum (gill cover).

O5.help: The posterior (rearward) point of the operculum (gill cover).

P1.help: The base of the pectoral fin's top fin ray.

P2.help: The distal tip of the pectoral fin's top fin ray.

P3.help: The distal tip of the pectoral fin's bottom fin ray.

P4.help: The base of the pectoral fin's bottom fin ray.

D1.help: The base of the dorsal fin's anterior (forward) fin ray.

D2.help: The distal tip of the dorsal fin's anterior (forward) fin ray.

D3.help: The distal tip of the dorsal fin's posterior (rearward) fin ray.

D4.help: The base of the dorsal fin's posterior (rearward) fin ray.

C1.help: The base of the caudal fin's top fin ray.

C2.help: The distal tip of the caudal fin's top fin ray.

C3.help: The distal tip of the caudal fin's bottom fin ray.

C4.help: Bottom intersection of the tail fin rays with the body.

C5.help: The midpoint of the base of the tail (between C1 and C3).

A1.help: The base of the anal fin's anterior (forward) fin ray.

A2.help: The distal tip of the anal fin's anterior (forward) fin ray.

A3.help: The distal tip of the anal fin's posterior (rearward) fin ray.

A4.help: The base of the anal fin's posterior (rearward) fin ray.

S1.help: The top curve of the body, from J1 to C2, excluding the dorsal fins.

S2.help: The bottom curve of the body, from J3 to C3, excluding the ventral and anal fins.

V1.help: The longest straight line that can be drawn through the fish from top to the bottom.
